greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with n and repeatedly apply the map x -> A087207(x) until we reach 0; a(n) is the number of steps needed, or -1 if 0 is never reached.
comment: There is a conjecture that 0 is always reached - see A087207.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000. If a(n) is not known, it is given in the form k + a(x). [A large file]
maple: f:= proc(n) local i; option remember;
for count from 0 while t <> 0 do
